IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: PORTER-STARKE SERVICES, INC. IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF A COMPREHENSIVE COMMUNITY MENTAL HEALTH CENTER THAT FOCUSES ON THE TREATMENT AND PREVENTION OF MENTAL ILLNESS, CHEMICAL DEPENDENCY AND ADDITIONS. THIS SERVICES ARE PROVIDED TO CHILDREN AND ADULTS UPON ADMISSION OR REFERRAL. THE CENTER EMPLOYS QUALIFIED PSYCHIATRISTS, PSYCHOLOGISTS, SOCIAL WORKERS, AND OTHER TO CONSULT AND TREAT INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES. THESE SERVICES INCLUDE INPATIENT SERVICES, OUTPATIENT TREATMENT INCLUDING INDIVIDUAL, GROUP AND FAMILY THERAPY, PSYCHIATRIC SERVICES INCLUDING MEDICATION MANAGEMENT, CONSULTATION, 24-HOUR SERVICES, CHEMICAL DEPENDENCY AND ADDICTION SERVICES, METHADONE CLINIC, COMMUNITY EDUCATION, PARTIAL HOSPITALIZATION DAY SERVICES, RESIDENTIAL SERVICES FOR SEVERAL POPULATIONS, TREATMENT PROGRAMS FOR ELEMENTARY AND SECONDARY STUDENTS, EMPLOYEE ASSISTANCE PROGRAMMING, EXPERImENTAL THERAPY AND CORPORATE TRAINING AND TEAM BUILDING PROGRAMS.
IRS990.MissionDescription: Porter-Starke Services, Inc. is dedicated to enhancing the quality of life within our communities.
IRS990.Description: Outpatient - The clinic provides mental health and addiction treatment to children, adolescents, and adults. The treatment provided includes crisis intervention, short-term counseling, medication management, group therapy, and educational services.

Activity2.Description: Inpatient - Psychiatric hospital for adults experiencing a mental, emotional, or behavioral episode or crisis.

Activity3.Description: COMMUNITY SUPPORT SERVICES - THIS PROGRAM PROVIDES A MEANS BY WHICH CHRONICALLY MENTALLY ILL PATIENTS MAY FIND SUCCESSFUL ADJUSTMENTS IN THE COMMUNITY AND AVOID RETURNING TO LONG-TERM FACILITIES. THEY ARE DIVIDED INTO SEVERAL PROGRAMS: CASE MANAGEMENT, GROUP SUPERVISED LIVING, PARTIAL HOSPITALIZATION, SEMI-INDEPENDENT LIVING, AND SUPERVISED TRANSITION.

ActivityOther.Description: DAY TREATMENT - THIS PROGRAM PROVIDES PARTIAL HOSPITALIZATION DAY SERVICES FOR ADULT AND CHILDREN. THE PROGRAM PROVES TREATMENT TO CHRONICALLY MENTALLY ILL INDIVIDUALS WHO MAY NEED MORE EXTENSIVE SUPPORT THAN CAN BE OFFERED IN AN OUTPATIENT SETTING. THE FOCAL POINT OF THE PROGRAMS IS GROUP PSYCHOTHERAPY, GROUP MEDICATION THERAPY, MONITORING, PSYCHO EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCES, AS WELL AS ACTIVITIES OF THERAPY AND RECREATION.

Form990ScheduleCPartIV.Explanation: Portion of dues paid to a Trade organization used for lobbying by the trade organization.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Part XI, XII, and XIII are not required as the organization is part of a consolidated financial statement. The consolidated financial statements are audited by an independent accounting firm and prepared in accordance with Generally accepted accounting principles.

Form990ScheduleHPartVI.BadDebtFootnote: Part III, Line 4: CHARGES FOR SERVICES TO PATIENTS ARE PRIMARILY BASED ON THE PATIENTS ABILITY TO PAY. THE ALLOWANCES OFFSET AGAINST PATIENT ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE REPRESENTS MANAGEMENTS ESTIMATE OF THE EXPECTED LOSSES TO BE REALIZED, AND IS BASED ON HISTORICAL EXPERIENCE, CURRENT ECONOMIC CONDITIONS, AND OTHER relevant factors.COSTING METHODS FOR LINES 2 AND 3 USED THE SAME CALCULATION DEVELOPED IN WORKSHEET 2 - RATIO OF PATIENT CARE for charges.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.ShortfallAsCommunityBenefit: Part III, Line 8: Other: Cost per day.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.DebtCollectionPolicy: Part III, Line 9b: PATIENTS UPON ADMISSION ARE ASKED TO SELF REPORT INCOME AND THEREFORE ARE SENT TO COLLECTIONS FOR FEES ALREADY DISCOUNTED BASED ON FAMILY SIZE AND INCOME.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.NeedsAssessment: Part VI, Line 2: Porter-Starke Services periodically conducts focus groups and regularly administers satisfaction surveys to patients which help determine community needs. Porter-Starke Services, Inc. is active in the community and works with community groups to provide requested mental health and addiction services.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.PatientEducationAssistance: Part VI, Line 3: All patients go through Porter-Starke's admission office where they are informed of the fees and eligible discounts. Inpatient clients if they currently do not have insurance and are Medicaid-eligible are assisted in applying for Medicaid.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.CommunityInformation: Part VI, Line 4: Porter-Starke Services, Inc. is a community mental health center which services Porter and Starke counties in Indiana. The clients are treated for mental health and addiction issues. Clients vary significantly in their income ranges, but over half the services are for clients with Medicaid or clients at 200% or below of the poverty level.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.OtherInformation: Part VI, Line 6: Porter-Starke Services, Inc. promotes wellness through a Learn at Lunch series and qualified mental health professional speakers' bureau made available at public forums.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: In accordance with its grant requirements and state regulations, the Center provides services to patients and charges them based on their ability to pay according to a sliding fee scale. The Center also adjusts charges based on contractual agreements with third-party payors. The Center maintains records to identify and monitor the level of charges foregone for services and supplies furnished under the charity care policy and contractual adjustments, the estimated cost of those services, and equivalent service statistics.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: YMCA Family annual memberships are provided to Chief executive officer and chief financial officer. Listed on Form 990, Part VII, Section A, line 1a. In addition country club dues are provided for the Chief Executive Officer, chief financial officer, and Medical Director.
$5,000 per Employee was contributed to a 457 plan on behalf of the following individuals listed on Form 990, Part VII, Section A, line 1a: Rocco Schiralli, Mary K. Idstein, and Anand Popli.

LoanTable.PurposeOfLoan: To purchase LLC membership interests in Northwest Indiana Health Systems

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 6
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization is organized as a nonprofit corporation with a board of directors.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Finance Committee (consisting of Board Chair, Vice-Chair, Secretary, and Treasurer, along with the CEO and CFO) received copies of the 990 and reviewed the form prior to the 990 being presented to the full board for approval.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Board regularly discloses any conflict which may exist with any business of the organization. No such conflict existed in this fiscal year.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The process for determining salary for key employees consisted of comparing salary to a state-wide salary survey of community health centers (like organizations) and the salary decision was made by independent persons on the board.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The documents are available upon request.

The organization is part of a consolidated financial statement. The consolidated financial statements are audited by an independent accounting firm and prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles.
The board of directors assumes responsibility for oversight of the audi of the financial statements and no processes have chagned from the prior year.
